title: Michael Strahan wakes up happy - and up for anything - Books
text:
BOOKS Buy this photo
Childhood taunts set Michael Strahan on the road to transformation.
WHO: Michael Strahan.
WHAT: Signing his new book "Wake Up Happy." WHEN: 7 p.m. Wednesday.
WHERE: Books and Greetings, 271G Livingston St., Northvale, booksandgreetings.com, 201-784-2665. HOW MUCH: Signing is free with purchase of the book ($26.99). In 1992, when he was a senior at Texas Southern University, Michael Strahan had both eyes on the prize: "I had wanted to be great, to make it into the pros and see how far I could go," he writes in his new book. "But now I needed to be great. Football was everything. There was no Plan B." That book, "Wake Up Happy," which Strahan will be signing Wednesday at Books and Greetings in Northvale, is subtitled "The Dream Big, Win Big Guide to Transforming Your Life." And, in case you haven't been paying attention, transformation is something the man knows a thing or two about. An Army brat who was born in Texas but did much of his growing up in Mannheim, Germany, Strahan recalls a childhood filled with Smurfs, gummy bears, Bienenstich ("a beautiful yellow cake confection with caramelized almonds and a butter-cream filling") and "Bob," the odd-sounding nickname chosen for him by his brothers because of his size. "Bob stands for Booty on Back," a sympathetic friend eventually told him. "They call you that because you're fat." Strahan's first successful stab at transformation occurred shortly thereafter, with more than a little help from Herschel Walker and Jane Fonda. He purchased the latter's first workout tape and wore it out. "If Jane said do 20 leg lifts, I did 50," he writes. Then, once the weight was off, Strahan began building muscle with the help of a book â€” "Herschel Walker's Basic Training." A love of football followed, including 15 years with the Giants, a Super Bowl win in his final season and a stint as a Fox football analyst. Throw in a few endorsement deals and a bunch of lucrative public appearances and that's it, right? Done! In Strahan's case, however, that was just the beginning. Busy man, busy month Not yet 44 (his birthday is Nov. 21), Strahan is having a busy October, promoting his book, his clothing line for J.C. Penney and "Play It Forward," the documentary he recently executive-produced. (It's been airing all month on Showtime.) Strahan is also a special correspondent for "Good Morning America" and, oh yes, the co-host of "Live! With Kelly and Michael." Sound busy enough for you?
